t: A Cry for Truth and Peace
In*pn my distress I called to the Lord,*s and*ln he answered me.
“Lord,*sln rescue me from lying lips and*ln a deceitful tongue.”
What*pn will he give you, and*ln what will he do to you, you*ln deceitful tongue?
A*ln warrior’s sharp arrows with*ln burning charcoal!
What*pn misery that I have stayed in Meshech, that*ln I have lived among the tents of Kedar!
I*ln have dwelt too long with*ln those who hate peace.
I*ln am for peace; but when I speak, they*ln are for war.
